subject: Education
title: Rewards Can Kill Motivation
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Rewards Can Kill Motivation.

hook.text: Pay kids to read and they read moreâ€”until you stop paying. Then they read less than before.

buildup.text: Extrinsic rewards seem like an easy motivation fix: gold stars, prizes, pizza parties.

discovery.text: The 'overjustification effect': external rewards can erode intrinsic motivation for enjoyable tasks.

twist.text: Rewards work fine for boring tasksâ€”the damage happens when you reward what someone already loves.

climax.text: Unexpected rewards after the fact don't harm motivationâ€”only pre-announced contingent ones do.

punchline.text: The fastest way to kill a hobby is to turn it into a job.

quiz.question: When do extrinsic rewards harm intrinsic motivation?
options: When they are pre-announced contingent rewards for already enjoyable tasks
When the rewards are too small
When they are given to adults instead of children
